message: just counted 38. not sure if that means i'm productive, lazy, or distracted.
just went to about:memory on Chrome, physical memory: 1,417,216k
Could mean any of those. :) I probably average ten or less.
For those of you with a high tab count: how much memory is/are your browser(s) using? Do you count by pointing at them with your finger or is there an info source that says?

I'm careful to not have many heavy pages open, one fb, one youtube, etc. Most of my open ones are simple text that I'm researching. 4GB RAM helps, sometimes they get swapped out and I wait 10 seconds to open a tab; my biggest problem is cpu, when I have a lot of pages with javascript etc I gotta kill the heavy ones.
14, on 2 windows, i don't like it when i can't read the title
8 b/c I am on iPhone and they limit it :(
oh, and that didn't count the MacBook Pro and the iPad: http://www.flickr.com/photos/areaguides/5599792218/
nice mic
53 on three monitors running on a Mac Pro in Chrome. No performance problems even the browser launches fast with all tabs loaded in less than 10 seconds.
@georgalis yes, and putting the wind sock over it helps with popping.
9 in chrome, 10 in iTerm
@craigshipp I have an "Altec Lansing" usb headset, under $30 and everyone says it has excellent sound but I need to re-solder a broken wire now.
Just two for me: Convore and my email. I typically only keep a few tabs open when I'm at home. When I'm at work, though, they typically get out of control.
30 in Chrome
13 in chrome , <3 add !
@unwrangle Good point on the need to read the tab. I'm usually ok as long as i can see the favicon from the tab.  once that disappears i get a panic feeling ;)

Whoa, dozens of tabs open at the same time? Have you got like several heads with more than one pair of eyes in them? Oh well, at least I've got only one pair of eyes, so... 

Anyway, right now I've got only one tab open, so Convore is getting my full attention. I might have up to four tabs and/or two windows open during any given browsing session, but usually no more than seven or eight, because keeping more tabs open would be pretty pointless. 
There's the browser history as well, the tabs eat up memory, all open pages collect and pile up cookies and fingerprint traps, I can instapaper something for a later read, and so on. I simply don't even like to have too many tabs open at the same time, especially when I don't need to have them open. I even quit my browsers once in a while.
The optimum is just one, or perhaps occasionally two or three tabs at the same time. With only one pair of eyes, that's plenty.
4 tabs in my browser; 6 apps total
@iurus I generally agree, I usually keep few tabs open.  Right now I have 4 open, so more than you, but still.

Many browsers have the most visited thumbnail page these days. I like that, and I think it is one thing that sort of helps in keeping the number of open tabs down. You can see a bunch of page thumbnails in one tab.
6. Gmail Personal (pinned) Gmail Business (pinned), Convore, my website, amazon & betfair.
5 tabs. mail, concvore, savings.com, bit.ly, twitter.

Too many... I always have Facebook, Twitter, Personal & Business Gmail, Ronin, Springboard and Convore open & pinned. Facebook & Convore since I collaborate a lot on them for project work, Twitter since I like to complain and I just can't register my anger at tiny things with the internet fast enough on my iPhones tiny keyboard. Otherwise I have a mix of google reader, utorrent webui, linked in or whatever I'm researching for my product.
3. All wikipedia
@Lloyd how do you manage productivity with facebook and twitter constantly open? I deleted both accounts, maintaining only convore.

Well I use a private Facebook group as a sort of Convore for a project I work on. Twitter is more of a break from work, where I go to have questions or where I go to moan because something in Photoshop doesn't work properly :) It's all about self control! Haha.

@Mustapha I agree, especially with Twitter. I had been completely hooked on it for a really long time and checked it more or less compulsively. I had to stop using it because I could never actually get anything done. I never had the same problem with Facebook, but I don't use it nearly as much.
47 in Firefox, 21 in Chrome!! I need to use bookmarks probably.
I usually don't have that many tabs open. Why? Because I like my desktop clean and simple.
@apfeljonas I don't quite follow you. What do your browser tabs have to do with how your desktop looks?
@TSJ sir, it is time to optimize your workflow haha. i'm at 21 myself and i feel so bloated!
15. 15 tabs. Mwah Hah Hah. </thecount>
